supersolids.functions.psi_gauss_2d_pdf(pos, mu=np.array([0.0, 0.0]), var=np.array([[1.0, 0.0], [0.0, 1.0]]))[source]¶

Gives values according to gaus dirstribution (2D) with meshgrid of x,y as input

Parameters

posnp.ndarray 3D

stacked meshgrid of an x (1D) and y (1D)

munp.ndarray 2D

Mean of gauss

varnp.ndarray 2D

Variance of gauss

Returns

z_meshmeshgrid, 2D surface values

values according to gaus dirstribution (2D) with meshgrid of x,y as input

supersolids.functions.camera_func_r(frame: int, r_0: float = 10.0, phi_0: float = 45.0, z_0: float = 20.0, r_per_frame: float = 10.0) → float[source]¶
supersolids.functions.camera_func_phi(frame: int, r_0: float = 10.0, phi_0: float = 45.0, z_0: float = 20.0, phi_per_frame: float = 10.0) → float[source]¶
supersolids.functions.camera_func_z(frame: int, r_0: float = 10.0, phi_0: float = 45.0, z_0: float = 20.0, z_per_frame: float = 10.0) → float[source]¶
supersolids.functions.camera_3d_trajectory(frame: int, r_func: Callable = None, phi_func: Callable = None, z_func: Callable = None, r_0: float = 10.0, phi_0: float = 45.0, z_0: float = 20.0) → Tuple[float, float, float][source]¶

Computes r, phi, z as the components of the camera position in the animation for the given frame. Depending on, if a callable function is given for the components, it is applied to the parameters or the start values are used.

Parameters

frameint, index

Index of the frame in the animation

r_funcCallable or None

r component of the movement of the camera.

phi_funcCallable or None

phi component of the movement of the camera.

z_funcCallable or None

z component of the movement of the camera.

r_0float

r component of the starting point of the camera movement.

phi_0float

phi component of the starting point of the camera movement.

z_0float

z component of the starting point of the camera movement.

Returns

r, phi, z as the components of the camera position in the animation for the given frame.

supersolids.functions.noise_mesh(min: float = 0.8, max: float = 1.2, shape: Tuple[int, int, int] = (64, 64, 64)) → np.ndarray[source]¶
supersolids.functions.datapoints_exponent :int = 6¶
